feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RISING WATER LEVELS ON SMALL STREAMS AND CREEKS DRAINING THE BROOKS RANGE... A series of fronts will impact the region, bringing copious amounts of widespread rain that will cause water levels to rise on small streams and creeks draining the Brooks Range. Rainfall totals will range from 1.50 to 2.50 inches, with localized amounts
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED SURF LIKELY ON THURSDAY... Strong south winds to gale force will move into the West Coast and bring elevated surf to parts of Norton Sound and the Yukon Delta on Thursday. Wave action will be the greatest along south facing coastlines, with anticipated surge values of 2-4 feet above the normal high tides. The highest values will likely impact northern
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued August 22 at 1:41PM AKDT until August 23 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...South winds gusting to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...From Black Rapids north. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 7 PM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 1:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding, with the worst conditions expected from the Kenai Lake to Funny River. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Wednesday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 11:40PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Judith Basin and southwestern Fergus Counties through 1215 AM MDT... At 1139 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms clustered around Moore, or 15 miles southwest of Lewistown, moving northeast at 10 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 11:36PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Meagher, southwestern Judith Basin and southeastern Cascade Counties through MIDNIGHT MDT... At 1135 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 28 miles northwest of White Sulphur Springs to 25 miles west of Harlowton. Movement was northeast at 10 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 11:30PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pondera and east central Teton Counties through MIDNIGHT MDT... At 1129 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dutton, or 18 miles southeast of Conrad, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 11:26PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Glacier County through MIDNIGHT MDT... At 1124 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a series of strong thunderstorms moving north at 20 mph over the Kiowa and Babb areas. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
